borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">5.&nbsp;The proposed development fails to provide adequate off-road parking space for future occupiers. In the absence of justification for such underprovision, the proposal could result in increased on-street parking, detrimental to local highways. Additionally, by reason of it's cramped arrangement which constrains access to the residential units above, the proposed cycle parking&nbsp;is&nbsp;unsuitable and unusuable. The applicant has also failed to demonstrate that adequate refuse provisions have been accomodated to service the commercial unit.<span style="font-size:11pt"></span>The proposal is therefore contrary to:</span></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">-&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);&nbsp;- Policies T4, T5 and T6.1 of the London Plan (March 2021);&nbsp;- Policies BR9 and BR10 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);&nbsp; - Policies DMT2 and DMT3&nbsp;of&nbsp; The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></p>

<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">3.&nbsp;The proposed development, by reason of the inappropriate&nbsp;access arrangement that merges&nbsp;pedestrian movement and vehicular traffic in a dangerous manner, fails&nbsp;to present a safe or appropriate access route for future occupants. The arrangement would additionally require future residential occupiers to access thier property via a commercial service yard, which is deemed inappropriate and unsafe.&nbsp;<span segoe="" ui="" style="color:#242424">The proposed development is therefore contrary to:</span></span></p><p style="background-attachment:initial; background-clip:initial; background-image:initial; background-origin:initial; background-position:initial; background-repeat:initial; background-size:initial"><span style="font-size:11pt">-&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);&nbsp;- Policies D4, D6, D11 and D6 of the London Plan (March 2021); Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); - Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);&nbsp; - Policy DMD1, SP2 and SP3 of&nbsp; The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></p>

<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">2.&nbsp;The proposed development would&nbsp;result in the loss of commercial floorspace at ground floor level on an established&nbsp;commercial&nbsp;parade&nbsp;within a designated Neighbourhood Centre. As such, the development may prejudice the viability of commercial uses at the site in the future detrimenting the vitality of the neighbourhood centre.&nbsp;<span segoe="" ui="" style="color:#242424">The proposed development is therefore contrary to:&nbsp;</span></span></p><p style="background-attachment:initial; background-clip:initial; background-image:initial; background-origin:initial; background-position:initial; background-repeat:initial; background-size:initial"><span style="font-size:11pt">-&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);&nbsp;- Policies E9 and SD8 of the London Plan (March 2021);&nbsp;- Policy CE1 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); Policy BE1 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);&nbsp; - Policies DME3 and SP2 of&nbsp; The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></p><p style="margin: 0cm; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;"><br></p>

<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">4.&nbsp;The proposed development fails to provide an acceptable quality of accommodation&nbsp;to facilitate a good standard of living, by reason&nbsp;of the lack of any private external amenity space provided for the use of future occupants. The existing flue of the ground floor takeaway (not depicted on the plans) would also discharge fumes and odour within close proximity of the proposed dormer window. The proposed development would introduce a poorer standard of accommodation than the existing dwelling which is detrimental to the living conditions of future occupiers.&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</span></p><p style="line-height:normal; margin-bottom:0cm" class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11pt">- National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC , 2021); - Policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (March 2021); - Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); - Policies BP5, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011); - Policies SP2, SP3 and DMD1 of the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;<span style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif">(Regulation 19 Submission version, December 2021)</span>; -The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012); -DCLG&nbsp;Technical Housing Standards (nationally described space standard) (DCLG, March 2015) (as amended)</span></p>

<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">1. The applicant has failed to present plans which accurately depict the&nbsp;proposed development.&nbsp;Specifically the proposed rear elevation and ground floor plan indicate mismatching features to the single storey extension, the use of the site has not been accurately portrayed, and the existing extraction flue has not been depicted, which could have detrimental impacts on the living conditions of future occupiers. The proposal could prejudice third parties who may otherwise have wished to comment on the application; the proposed development cannot be accurately assessed and it cannot be demonstrated that it would be supported by the Development Plan. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span pt="" sans="">- National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;</span>National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);&nbsp;<span pt="" sans="">- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021); - Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;<span pt="" sans="">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);&nbsp;<span pt="" sans="">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</span><span pt="" sans="">- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;</span>The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></p>
description: Demolition of existing single storey rear extension and construction of a new single storey rear extension, alterations to the shop front and relocation of the side entrance, conversion of existing flat above into two flats (1x1 bedroom and 1x2 bedroom) involving the construction of a rear dormer extension including three roof lights to the front and two to the rear and a two storey rear infill extension to the first and a second floors

constraints_details.result: Kang Sheng, 292 Lodge Avenue, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM8 2HF
292a Lodge Avenue, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM8 2HF
